one_reviews_text: I love this game its so fun but then i cant leave the game without having to restart all over again. I really wish there was a way to save other wise its an amazing game overall.
I thought the program ran well. It was detailed in the components and seemed very accurate. Overall a good experiance and an opportunity to work on something I might not have done otherwise.

review_title: it wont show on my quest 2
one_reviews_text: i want to play the demo and see what it like but it wont show up on my quest 2 and i cant find anything to see if  poeple have the same problem so plz help

the game itself is really good but, when i'm left with only 2 to 3 parts i'm often left there flailing a part around the engine because i don't know where it's supposed to go. i will appreciate if the devs add a button on the menu to highlight where a specific part attaches.

this is like car mechanic simulator but a lot more in depth

bought the game immediately after completing the demo
awesome attention to detail, realistic, nice graphics

frequent updates with new features, easy 30 hours+ worth of gameplay

Just like some of the other people, played through the demo and really liked it. Its an awesome great looking game that gets updated frequently with additional features and the roadmap on where the game is going looks promising.
this is what i was expecting when i played the xbox game. it was not even close. the wrench kept sticking for me and i had alot of over torqued bolts

review_title: I always like when games have demos
one_reviews_text: I appreciate the devs for making this demo. Its a pretty in depth demo too., where in you get to build an entire engine from scratch. Its a little frusterating because it's easy to mess up a step and get loss and end up restarting from scratch. Its also outdated. The movement mechanics in the real game have improved and now the wrenches work a little different. I think it would be a good idea if the demo was the tutorial for the up-to-date full game.
Very graphical ,the closer way to investigate a gear.Very nice.

Very nicely put together experiance.  Informative and fun.
Good interface and nice texturing.
Really well done guys.  Thank you.

Still building my block, it is so well done I think I can smell the engine oil!

My only suggestion would be to have the ability to change your hight in game so it can be played while seated, as you have to stand for the entire block build and my back is getting too old!!
My car goes brrrrrr now.  VRoom vroom!

I wrote a review thinking that Wrench had a problem because I could not figure out how to change a spark plug. I received a response and was told to access extensions for the wrenches using A or X. I tried. Only saw the wrenches and no extensions. I was ready to write another review because I was a little mad. Well I played with it awhile and figured out I was not doing things right. So I want to apologize to the developers of Wrench for all the mean things I thought and tell all of you I LOVE THIS APP....I'm kinda old so maybe this new technology is a little hard for me. But I appreciate your patience with me and all your help. Hope this becomes the number one app of all times.

Whats Bad
Start the game too short, I felt like a dwarf, no way of changing settings ot be "taller". 
Objects you pick up and release just float where you release them, game needs gravity!
graphics isnt clerar, even wrtitten text right in front of you is unreadable, needs fixing.
Rotation is not smooth, its arc turning, needs smooth turning.

Good
no silly teleporting if you choose not to, this is something which is top of players list glad to see it included.

Thats it, couldnt actally play it for more than a few minutes because couldnt read anything and got peeved off with objects floating all over the room.
Needs a lot of work.

Note the demo is NOT representative of where the game is at now. The demo is full of frustration, but it makes you want to go back and do things right.

Tip: Wrench spinner only gets you to 2Nm of force. Let go of the trigger and then hand tighten until it clicks. I literally built the entire engine with 2Nm bolts and... well it didn't start. Tutorial error, but a lesson learned.

FUN!!!

review_title: Very good just needs some fine tuning
one_reviews_text: I love this game. The graphics are unreal! The only thing that bothers me is tightening and loosening bolts. It often happens that the wrench snaps to the wrong bolt and messes everything up. It would also be nice to hold the wrench at a different rotation instead of a fixed position relative to the hand, if that makes sense. Sometimes i'm really bending my wrists in weird angles when i'd rather just change the grip of the wrench. Also i couldnt get the engine to start because apparently the valve timing was off by 0 degrees (????).

I've rebuilt the engine in the demo three times! And it still wouldnt start because I either had half a quart too much oil, or the timing was literally 0.01* off! And you dont even get to build the whole engine, just the pistons and oil pump. And the tutuorial doesnt explain how to use the tools or time the engine! I hope the full game is better, but the demo is just so unbareable.
Trying to get controls to do what you want can be very frustrating,and when you think you have it done you aren't

First, I love the fact that there's a demo, so you can try before you buy. So rare these days.

Second, this kinda blew my expectations right out of the water. The controls are slightly wonky, but otherwise I now know I will definitely be getting my moneys worth out of the full version and will definitely be buying!

I love trying to work on my own engine, but as many others, lack some of the knowledge and training and courage to do it all.  But this gives an awesome way to get in to it.  The details are so, well, detailed!  You can take every nut and bolt off, every thing.  I have yet to finish the demo build, only because i keep forgetting parts.  It's sooo sooo good.  Seriously, have you thought about getting in to the tech schools and mechanic schools with this?  Too cool

The app is really great. Great graphics, and all the pieces and steps as it would be in real life. It was great fun learning about it all, using the tools, and figuring out the process. I built my engine in a few hours but needed to go somewhere just as I was finishing it and putting the timing belt on. I couldn't find an exit or save button on the tablet (the thing that gives you the instructions), so I naively just shut the app down, assuming it would auto-save. Alas when I next opened it up to finish the engine, all the parts were right back on the table. If there was a save button, this would be a 5 star rating. As it is, I can't be bothered to spend another couple of hours putting it back together just to get to where I was, which is a real shame because I really wanted to see it in action.

That being said, I am currently downloading the full version of the game because I just want to build more stuff! Hopefully the full version will have a dedicated quit button. I encourage you all to try it.

GRR dangit! I love this game so much but after playing for a while, the screen goes black and the game freezes, unable to be saved.  I've tried making this engine 5 times so far and it just keeps happening.  Any help would be greatly appreciated, the only thing keeping me from buying the full game is the fear that this will happen in the full version.  To my knowledge there's no way to save in this demo, so I can't just keep saving every couple of minutes like I want to.  Is there a way to save in the full game?

This can be a frustating and rewarding game all in one. I would recommend it. I built the engine twice. FIrst time I had a few bolts not to torque spec and didn't want to tear down the engine to get to them. Tried again another day and after solving a few problems, success! If you don't have everything right, the engine will not start. Beware, you can accidentally get your wrench on bolts that are not even part of the engine assembly process and change the value to out of spec and engine will not start until you correct it. This happened to me. Also when manipulating the engine while working on it you can accidentally grab parts inside the engine and uninstall them. And it can be a real pain to get them back where they go. (You may have to stick your head literally inside the engine).  I recommend only grabbing the engine near the edge to turn it. Timing can be a bit of trouble to get right as well, you may have to pull the belt off a few times to get it right. (Hint - turn the cams and crank with a medium ratchet to position them, turn the engine over and make sure it's right). Overall this was a lot of fun and gave my brain a workout:)

For a Demo it is very lengthy. Graphics are great. No physics on the parts is a little disapointing but I can understand why they dont parts just rolling around everywhere. It would be very easy to mix bolts and items up.

Complete rubbish, never got past the second test at the work bench before it locked up. Hands jump all over the place, tools etc go straight through the bench.
Probably good enough if it ran ok but ?
Controls are rough and really hard to move around. I had no idea what I was doing and could not even figure out how to unscrew something. Needs alot of work to be functional.

review_title: Four words: Wait for Joystick Turning
one_reviews_text: Good visuals, but completly unplayable because I'm using a front facing configuration.
Great Job. Was a bit dizzy sometimes, anyway 5 stars cause now i have a better understandig how those engines are build. Thanks.
super cool
Decent time, but ran into some glitches. Really cool concept, though. I gave the full game a purchase.
Please make more of these. add different engines like scooters, airplane motors, chainsaws any type of engine you can get your hands on. a v8 would be a+++

I should probably give this five stars for being hours of free education and fun, but there are still areas for improvement.
1) When the menu is open to select torque wrench, etc., make it impossible to accidentally grab and manipulate additional objects (beyond what may already be in your hand).
2) For torque adjustments allow a 0.2 second delay after a single click (i.e. 0.1 NM) before ramping continously.  This will make single clicks easier.  Then after the 0.2 seconds, ramp at a constant rate that is 2x or 3x as fast as the current rate.
2) Increase speed of hand-torqueing bolts to 2x or 3x.  It should not take 5 seconds per bolt that is already snug.
3) Cam timing is buggy because sometimes it gave me -359.999 degrees with no start, and sometimes +.001 degrees with successful start.  I made no changes, and just hit the start button again, but there is less than 50% success rate.
4)  I found a possible bug where I grabbed a bearing half out of the crankshaft journal while the crankshaft, pistons, and oilpan were bolted.  I should have known something was wrong when I had to skip past the crankshaft section.  The strange thing was that before I removed the bearing, it moved along with the engine block. 
5) The controls are a bit clunky when learning, and it takes a while to figure everything out to where you're good at it.  The biggest problems are A) The tutorial is not very clear that electric mode does NOT torque to the indicated value B) grabbing the wrong object, (which could be fixed by more obviously highlighting the object to be picked up (one highlight per hand) and then removing the highlight once it's picked up, and C)  Tutorial should discuss view modes (joystick depress). Reduce amount of rotation per side joystick to 1/2 current value
This is exactly what VR will be used for in an enterprise setting. It's a lot of fun and teaches you about actual car engine maintenance.
Great experience marred only by some interface issues., such as loosing bolts through the tabletop.  I failed torquing properly the first time out and am anxious to try again, so that's a good sign.

review_title: Two words. Legen.. wait for it... dary
one_reviews_text:
This is the most awesome experience i have dealt with in VR. 
Other than maybe making it so that your hands dont keep grabing the engine instead of the wrench when you letgo to stop torquing bolts. 100% AAA quality game. 
Can't wait for the full release it will be a day one buy for me. 
(also having your cam phasing off is realitively common with miatas. I advance my intake by 1 tooth, and retard the exhaust by 1 tooth. Gets you a bit more overlap in the cams and some better top end.) Only sad that i didn't get to hear the engine run once i completed it. :(

Walked my 6yr old through building an engine today, i watched the monitor and he was in VR.  I know it's not EXCACTLY like building a complete engine, but I was blown away at the depth of it, all the different parts needed for installation, etc.  Anxiously awaiting the full release!!!

review_title: A new way of home learning!
one_reviews_text: This isn't so much a game, more of an educational tool. To the developers, you are onto something here, genuine skills can be learnt from this style of software. As a motorsport mechanic I am blown away by the quality of this demo. Absolutely fantastic and I am only too willing to pay for what ever evolves from this. Please keep at it and target the training/education market as well, this is truley something.
It's fun.

the second i saw this was available to try i fired up the rift and instantly had to play.  building the engine every bolt and part really brought a sense of accomplishment to me and while there are a few niggles to iron out that maybe the dev did already its an experience i cant wait to try. its out now on steam and i am really tempted to buy and if the time come available before the game shows up on the oculus store i really might. i just hope its a little more forgiving on a noob like me

Very nicely made lil game. enjoyed building the engine alot. its just a shame ive never gotten to start it as the engine timing thing is completly bugged. The timing thing itself is already incerdibly annoying and cumbersome since the cams keep changing way more than they are needed to reach the perfect mark. However whicg I found far more annoying is that after youve finally achieved the perfect positions for timing the engine still does not start as it often randomly says the timing is wrong while the timing markers are alligned perfectly. It just randomly messes up the timing and you gotta do everything over again. mustve tried about 8 times now and ive never gotten it to work. It once even said the timing belt was -399.99 degrees off.
Such a shame cause the rest of the game is amazing.

Parts all look like the real deal. It's really fun doing this engine assembly. Only suggestion would be a better order of assembly. If you leave out something small, like the thrust bearings, you're up the creek and need to start over or take the crankshaft all apart again. I used to rebuild automatic transmissions and just like engines, the assembly order is critical.
EDIT:  Looks like the vanishing parts bug has been fixed. The only issue I can see now is the torque specs are a little buggy. For example, I was extra carefull to get each nut and bolt exactly to specs, but at engine startup, it failed because a few of the torque specs were now showing as way off and I know they were reading correct at assembly (at least according to the wrench torque break specs the instructions provided). That appears to be bugged somewhat. Again, as a transmission mechanic for many years, I know how to use a torque wrench. After removing and tightening the bolts again, the engine cranked right up. Very cool experience.

review_title: Very cool! How do I save my progress?
one_reviews_text: I really enjoyed working throught the engine block and camshaft assembly. I was pretty slow and had to backtrack once so I'm sure I spent over an hour on it. I was hoping to save my work and continue to the next phase at a later time but I wasn't able to figure out how to do that. Otherwise this is really cool. I'd love to be able to set my tools on the table rather than pulling them from the floating menu. Once you let go of a tool and lose sight of it it seems to disappear I suppose that is pretty realistic though for tools to vanish while you're not paying attention. :)
i want to buy it

This demo made me buy the EA version on Steam in an instant: https://store.steampowered.com/app/936720/Wrench/?curator_clanid=4777282&utm_source=SteamDB

The Devs (a 2 man crew) are constantly updating what, to me, seems to become the Mechanic Sim VR users long for!

Excelent visuals and very detailed. I recommend this demo but recommend the (fuller) on Steam more. For those of you who dislike Steam for whatever reason I can only hope the Devs will bring it to Oculus Store as well.

This game was amazing, the only gripe i have is that the engine did not start because intake bolts were not properly torqued? Went through them and still no go. The torqueing seems a little off and the torque wrench attached to every bolt not the ones I was intending on tightening. Other than that amazing game

I anjoyed this a lot. It would get 5 stars except for the torque seems to be buggy. I made sure to torque every bolt to the specks. However at startup, it would not start and told mebissuebwas one bolt was miss torqued. I also made sure to set timing as it said to set it and it told me that was off as well. I am waiting for the full game in Hope's that those issues are corrected and more then one engine to work on.

review_title: I Spent Over 3hrs Doing Everything Wrong
one_reviews_text:
I'm not blaming the game, obviously ^. It was fun. Next time though, I'll have someone else play and watch them instead.

Things I'd like to see change:

1) Upon users pressing B to pull up their "inventory" items should pop up on their wrist allowing users to select tools that way v.s. a large selection of tools that obtrude into objects.

2) Height Adjustable Tables.

3) Backround music. Yes I was playing my own but in-game music would be nice too. Just be sure to give us the option to turn it off or adjust the volume as we please.

4) The angle at which tools are held in users hands.

5) The ability to walk faster.

6) Items (such as screws and tools) should no be able to be placed inside of tables. (I had a hard time finding one piece at one point).

Things I Liked:

1) In-game Pixel Density Adjustment

2) In-game tutorials

3) The attention to detail

Very, very excellent graphics. Now, i can imagine what business education apps can affort.
For the official version i wish, that every thing including the workbench will be solid and cannot put into the other and have force of gravity, so nothing will float in the air. This is neccessary to feel like in reality, imo.

Keep working in this way....

review_title: Wow, this could be a big thing!
one_reviews_text:
I've never experienced a more realistic enginge building / assembly game...
That could be a great thing for trainee's at big Automotive concerns.
In my case @Volkswagen in Wolfsburg, Germany- they get thrown in the cold water by disassembling and again assambling two kinds of combustion engines within one or two weeks.

These simulation could be a great opportunity to train the young mechanics before they get their hands on the real deal.
Love it!

1 hour and 30 mins to put my first engine together

12 bolts not torqued correctly <-- not sure why im sure i checked them all and done em correctly
And my timing was off and it failed to start sadly

Eitherway love it wil fail to build the engine again

review_title: amazing cant wait to see more
one_reviews_text: this game truly shows what you can accomplish with VR. cant wait to see more features.

This is a great simulator and demonstration of what the game can become. The models are great, the instructions are usually clear enough, and the toolset is sufficient. It's limited to just assembling a single engine, but that is enough to get the point across and show what the game can be. There are non-VR games where you assemble or dissemble things, and this shows how much better it is in VR.
This can provide a great hands-on learning experience without getting your hands dirty. It could benefit from a few minor tweaks, and it took me a while to figure out that the tools really are powered, but they truly are minor tweaks. For example, it would be nice if the torque wrench adjustments had some acceleration when going through the increments, so it doesn't take quite as long to change from 15 to 50. And it takes a bit longer than I'd hope to hit the torque limit for each bolt. And there are a few stages of the instructions that could use a bit more text, even though the pictures are more than sufficient. Those really are the only tweaks I could suggest; the game is still a 10 out of 10 for its limited scope, especially when it is free.

I only had to dissassemble the engine three times because I forgot parts - which is very realistic and similar to my prior experience. The only flaw is that the oil containers run out eventually. That's not a problem for anyone else, but I experimented to see what happens if you pour oil over everything (including the player) and ended up a little bit short of the ideal amount. I expect I'll play the game again anyway, so at least that gives me a goal.

This is amazing, this is first time a game made me think so mutch about the future of VR, and what influence it can have. You could allmost make a hole education this way. You can learn anything this way, and do it over and over untill your a master at it, or use it as training for a specific job/task. Very nice experience.

This was a really neat "game" and I'm looking forward to more from this developer. I'd love to build a rotary engine. :)

Just like in real life, if you do something out of order or forget a part you have to undo a bunch of bolts and redo it all. I had to remove the oil pan twice haha.

The only real issue I had was with bolt torques like some other people. I was very careful to set the wrenches to the exact specified torque for every bolt. (Yes I've used torque wrenches before.) But when I got to the end it showed all the bolts were torqued incorrectly so the engine didn't start. :(  
...I've just watched a video on the game's website and realized I may have done it wrong. So I will try again later. I was going to gave this 4 stars instead of 5 because of the torque issue but it seems that was possibly my error and not a bug.

Some things I think would be cool would be a save function and maybe an "expert" mode where everything is affected by gravity. :)

Three times ive tried building this engine, twice ive gotten it built, no times have i actually gotten it to start. My record is 8 bolts incorrectly torqed! Took me 40 mins to fully build, and i enjoy it each time. Can't wait to see the full game, will be buying it asap!

the engine building was super realistic and i only had two small issues 
1. the bolts werent always going in
2. this one is just a personal preference is to have the option for a smooth walking and turning style of movement instead of teleporting

This is really great! I took my time building the engine. Of course I got the dreaded torque specs is wrong when I know it was done correctly just like everyone else. But that didn't stop me. It's a great learning tool for an understanding how an engine is put together and how it works. I've rebuilt several engines when I was younger. So right away I knew how it went all together. I'm looking foward to the full game when it's released!

This will be an amazing educational program for everybody wanting to learn engine mechanics. The possibilities are endless, And the graphical details are awesome. Really looking forward to the full release. Hope they also put the GY6 in there as it is one of  the most commonly used moped  engines.

review_title: As a Petrolhead: Best VR Exp. ever!
one_reviews_text:
Beeing a Petrolhead myself, i already worked on the MX5 engine myself :) I really really love the App - will buy TOTALLY!
Graphics are awesome! Thanks thanks for this.
Three things for improving: 1) Cant place the Gaskets 2) Make it that you can roughly adjust the Torque of the Electric wrench (dont wanna torque all the minor screws like valve cover) 3) Make it that you can rotate things you hold in your hand
review_feedback:
Rotating parts in your hand is an interesting idea. We could bind that to thumbstick while holding a part. 

As for bolt torquing, its tough to find the right balance between pleasing different audiences. I think one option is a casual mode where bolts only need to be run down and can't break.

review_title: Just as annoying as it is in real life
one_reviews_text:
About as real and annoying as it is in real life, complete with curse words when you forget something and have to dissasemble most of the engine, but without the engine oil sinking deep into blood filled cuts on my hands.

5 stars, will be buying the full version on release day for more oil-free masochism.

This demo showcasing the upcoming full game had more polish and content than most paid titles. The attention to detail and mechanics are incredible. I spent an hour and twenty minutes building the engine in the demo and left wanting more. It took me back to my childhood days of building Lego. I can’t wait for the full release. Great work from the devs.

review_title: Haynes manuals should be VERY worried!
one_reviews_text:
I just spent half an hour in this demo.  If you have any interest in cars/mechanics its SUPERB.  Graphically its beautiful too.   I tried to put the engine together.  Managed to seat the cam shaft and brackets before realising I'd left out the two tiny thrust bearings on the no4 shaft.  Doh!  Now I've got to unbolt everything again :-)  Grabbing things and locating them is slightly fiddly - but this has amazing potential.  I think I'd find it really therapeutic to build a virtual car.  It's like a jigsaw puzzle in 3D - and I'd be learning stuff

I'm very tempted to buy the full thing when it releases.  There's nothing like this in pancake land!

NB Played version 1.3 which fixed the dissapearing parts noted in another review.  Was all good for me!

Very intuitive manipulation of the tools and parts. I would prefer the parts scanner not to disappear so fast however.

(thanks for your feedback, previously had a problem with Entitlement check failed : had to restart computer then it worked. Oculus Home env was not showing either. However it is surprising you need this check on a free demo ? Crow has not it for example)
review_feedback: I don't think this is an issue with the demo. Contact oculus support. We implement the entitlement check (as required for the oculus store) but the oculus service is responsible for the managing the entitlement. Googling the issue there are reports of people solving this in other games by logging out and then back into their oculus accounts.

one_reviews_text:
Absolutely love it! Can't wait for the full game. Yes, it has some issues, but none of them really kept me from enjoying the game. Occasionally the game would shake a bit as if there was an issue with my tracking, but I'm certain it's not my tracking. I haven't been able to get the engine started. I'm assuming all bolts have to be torqued to spec? I was really careful the second time I put it together but then one of my head bolts was loose. When I removed the valve cover to make the correction the valve cover disappeared. It wasn't on the ground any where, just gone. Couldn't figure out a way to get it back so I gave up that attempt. I'll go back at some point and try again. It would be awesome if you could race people online in the same garage.

UPDATE: Finally, had the opportunity to try again, and I was able to start the engine. So satisfying!

Some issues getting the bolts in the hole. 
Just like wrenching on my car had to yell at it.
The game crashed and I had to start over.

Ok be honest who put the oil pan on then looked right to see the pistions sitting on the table?
Well done. I wish my girl friend would play she would love it.

Update
Started over. 
Put it together and tried to start the engine.
Well half the bolts were the wrong torque. 
I was very carful about this as I saw someone else had the same issue.
Disappointing as I don't want to start over or tear it down again.

1: If I had to start over every time the SO called me into the house or had to stop for the night it would get old. I hope the full version has a save progress.
2: There should be some indication when the bolts are the correct torque. If I put a wrench on a bolt and its already good it should give me another click.
3: The way the wrench is held is not comfortable and I don't see how to change it.
4: Hell yes I threw the wrench out the window, several times

Bottom line I love this idea and cant wait to get the full game.
Now build me a shop class!!!!

I am by no means a mechanic, but I REALLY enjoyed this demo!! I used Oculus to "pin" my spotify window behind me, then built the engine while listening to music at my own pace. I didn't expect it to be so relaxing and fulfilling, even though I couldn't figure out the timing belt and never got the engine to start... I really look forward to the completed product! This one I will buy for sure!

Very well done. I have never assembled an engine so I found myself needed more guidance on what to do (where to put what where). It would be very helpful to have more guidance available when needed which highlights the specific steps that are needed. Currently you can lose pieces in the work table. It would be help to have collider on the table surface

Great idea. A lot of fun. Right up until the point that one of the parts dissappeared. (I think it was called the windage tube) I had it one second, then it was gone. I searched all over the room and couldn't find it. Built the engine without it and didn't get the joy of actually watching then engine run. There should be a way to regenerat lost parts when they dissappear.
review_feedback: Can you email me at missingdigitgames@gmail.com so I can get a bit more information to reproduce the issue?

review_title: PLEASE HURRY UP AND DROP THE EA NOW
one_reviews_text:
Hi guys i'm despirate for this to come out now just played the demo and i build it twice

here you go guys to keep you warm and excited for the game https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GOeL5cvFibs&feature=youtu.be

Very nicely done!!! Graphics and models are really top notch.  Spent a good couple of hours tinkering.

5 star experience. My suggestions (although i'm sure you're on it):
- More information on what each part does and why it's needed. Maybe some more info or history
- Would love to see it 'run'. Showing timing and the path of the water, oil, air and fuel flows...
- Better SFX. MUSIC!
- The wrenches are a little annoying how they don't want to release
- Trun on physics. Or at least have an option.
- Build order was sometimes a little unclear. If you follow the tutorial strictly it's ok, but the build instructions con sometimes lead you in to doing things in the wrong order (minor)
- Better environment(s)
- The rest of the freaking car!!! :)

Putting an engine together,  what could be better?

Some suggestions for the future

* Add an extension (auto length?) between the socket and ratchet when the ratchet unavoidably interferes with components. It breaks immersion when the ratchet can move through the engine block for instance

* Allow an option for a more comprehensive build. I.E. piston pins, rings / cams valves etc...

* Electrical diagnosis-DVOM to test/troubleshoot  starters, alternators, ignition systems etc...

* Make the table surface solid and allow parts / tools to rest on it

* An optional engine stand would be nice so I don't keep grabbing and moving the block by accident

* I love the awesome flashlight and it would be cool to have a head mounted flashlight as well

This concept is easily one of the best applications I've seen in VR, and Wrench does a fantastic job of executing it. As someone who has been working on Miatas for the last 5 years or so, I can attest to the accuracy and detail of all the parts. The graphics, gameplay, technical accuracy, and the guides are all excellent. I'm in about 1/3 of the way through building an Exocet in real life, and I cannot wait for the full version of this game to come out so I can practice in VR before performing the real steps in my garage.

review_title: Really good but i hope final product is
one_reviews_text:
Been waiting for this to drop for some time, i don't have that much of an interest in car mechannics but the idea intreages me. 
First off i really like the idea & time spent in the demo was really enjoyable. But i really hope the game is released as early access & the final product is much better. What is good:
The graphics are great, the parts looks very realistic & the dev has done a fantastic job here. The detail of the parts is exquisite.
The idea is great, there is the educational side, the puzzle element, the future possibilities of where this could go (imagine if they add not just cars but bikes, trains aircraft). 
Not so good:
Options are ok but free movement is a bit slow, its not dynamic. I think some tweaking is needed here. 
The enviroment you work in basically looks nothing like a garage & just looks like a generic house pulled of unreal content library. 
Sound doesn't match the quality of the graphics, there is no atmospheric background noise for example. Just needs more work imo. 
Controls & tools just needs refining, the tool displays are a little glitchy, need a better way to aim the scanner. These are quite minor things but the tools & way you interact with the enviroment is the most important thing imo.
review_feedback: You can adjust movement speed in the settings app.

review_title: Great Demo and Such Future Potential
one_reviews_text:
One of the best edutainment VR experiences I've had. Detailed and realistic engine parts and basic assembly. I haven't touched a car engine like this since high school 30 years ago and said to my wife how amazing something like this would have been in school back then. The potential for this is also incredibly wide open with hopes that the full version will involve all vehicle systems (brakes, exhaust, suspension etc...) to service,  modify and repair. Also looking forward to multiple engines of different types and how the actual gameplay elements will come into this. I expect there may be elements based on how fast to repair, accuracy and tweaking performance just as a basic start.

Looking forward to more tools, to work on the vehicles too.

Some tweaking to do before full release on things like the stickyness of your hands, easier navigation in the in game tablet and some overall minor quality of life options will make it even better.

Excellent work so far and this free demo certainly makes me look forward to the full release.

I'm giving this two stars because the idea is great, but the implementation has that feel of both being written by somebody who isn't very familiar with VR and has no experience working on engines. It's extremely off-putting to literally stick your wrenches through the side of an engine block to tighten bolts. This pretty much ruins one of the primary experiences of using tools which is, using the correct tool for the job. It's cute that you are able to break bolts by overtorquing them, but it should also be possible to break the smaller wrenches by misusing them. Furthermore, please add extensions so that the wrench handle isn't tightening through solid objects. That is jarringly silly. Next, it may sound rude, but do the developers ever used the teleport system in the program? Why am I not facing the direction of the arrow after teleporting? The movement in your program is counter intuitive, and until I figured out the free movement, couldn't get properly situated near the working spaces. Another issue is gravity. Implement some consistent form of it. I want to put my bolts into the parts bowl, not have them floating mysteriously above it. I also want my engine block mounted to an engine stand, not floating in mid air, so I can move it with some consistency and be able to work with it. As another reviewer stated, it would be good if the installation was performed in a more proper fashion. I had the windage tray installed before the pistons went in, thanks to your silly instructions. Once the more irritating aspects of this title get worked out, I think it can easily be a five star install. Until then however, one of the absolute most frustrating VR titles I've tried to work my way through. I also ran into the problem of being unable to turn the crank shafts to set the timing. Please make it clear that you can use the standard wrench on them. I get you can't turn them by hand, but it wasn't immediately obvious that my standard wrenches were what I was looking for.

Was a good experience, well detailed and fun. I didnt get the engine to run cause I had random bolts not torqued properly apparently and trying to track them down was impossible.
Made the rookie mistake of just installing what was on the table in order so had to take the oil pan (which has the most bolts) off to put the pistons in. :)  Fun though!
This game is pretty realistic and oddly enjoyable. As an actual car mechanic I can say this is really well done.

review_title: If you're a gearhead, this is the game!
one_reviews_text:
I never write reviews on games because everyone else seems to do their own justice. But I have been following this game for over a year, and when I saw the demo was out, I stayed up all night to build my first engine on the platform. Having rebuilt multiple engines in real life, this is as close as a video game has ever been to the real experiance. I am always chasing more realistic games that actually allow you to do the work the way it is supposed to be done. I've seen some comments that they are unable to install gaskets, try installing them on the part itself or on the engine block. As for the comment saying they didn't want to torque every bolt, I agree with the developer that there should be different modes that allow for a more casual gameplay. You should call it "Shade-Tree Mechanic" and in the description instruct that everything can be German torqued "Good and tight." It would be nice to see later implementation of boundries so tools can not go through the block and forces the player to tear down the engine if they forget to install something. But this would also require the implementation of extensions for each rachet. As for things missing from the game, my judgement is a little clouded from the excitment that the demo is out. I'm not sure if anyone else is having this issue, but I have no audio for the game. I don't mind though because I just blast music like I do in my actual shop. There's an idea though, maybe add a shop radio that players can drop their own .MP3 files into and listen to while playing. I don't know if it interests the developer, but maybe instead of a tool inventory, you have a physical tool box you have to roll to where you are working at?
I can't express how excited I am and the endless possibilities this creates for gearheads everywhere. Amazing work so far, and I look forward to the final product.

I was unable to get the cam timing correct, couldn't figure out on my own the right way to do it with tools, but I was extremely impressed with the whole experience.

I also aparently don't have any clue how to use a torque wrench.  For some reason I thought you were supposed to wrench on them up until they click/break.  I thought I did that, but in the end, when my engine wouldn't start (timing was way off) I also got a list of just about every single bolt in the system being over torqued.   So I suppose I was doing it wrong? 

With all that said, I still thought it was a very cool experience, and I wish I could get a model for an old Continental O-170, because that's what I used to have on my airplane and I would love to learn more about everything going on inside of it.

Lastly, I thought the system would be a little more "hand holdy" getting me through the steps, and I was actually happy it wasn't.  Part of the challenge was scanning parts, looking at diagrams and figuring out on my own the correct order to install.    After I got the oil pan on and was ready to move onto the next step I realized that I completely forgot a couple of the seals...  Yikes, had to take the whole thing apart and do it again.... 10/10  That is exacly the kind of thing that happens to me in the real world when putting things together...

..that hasn't been said already?  A fair bit if I'm honest! ;-)
It's nice that they are going for it, hardcore!!! Thing is, I keep glitching through this and through that. I wait for the "green" and I get it and sometimes I do not.

I fully appreciate this early demo territory and that's why I gave 4/5*  I remember (as a 18 year old) removing my whole (Vauxhall S*itvette) Gear box on my Jack Jones to replace an exploded Clutchplate. I got through that and it actually worked fine as well so FU2 :-) I presume I know what I'm sposed to be doing here...
I do do <<(HE SAID "DO DO") ... what the voice is saying but summat is wrong, it's just not going 'green' as is required. 
No matter, this is great fun and I am sure it will all be sorted, I love *working* in VR, I expect the devs to pay me the going rate though!!

Considering this game was developed by only one person, the attention to detail is amazing! This is a great game to learn about the mechanics of the engine and how the suspension is put together. Although there are a coulple minor bugs (which you would expect from a demo) I would definitely recomend this to beginners and advanced car enthusiasts.

If you are at all interested in learning about this stuff this game is pretty great.  

Howerver, I got stuck due to a bug with the crank shaft wrench.  My wrench is stuck behind the crankshaft pulley and there is no way to remove it.  I can't remove the crankshaft pully either since the wrench is stuck.   Have to reset the game as there is no way to continue.

I actually managed to get the crankshaft pulley off but the tool is still stuck in the pulley and there is no way to remove the tool.  I assume i have the tool on backwards and that is why it is stuck.  Developers def need to fix this bug.
i like it but i cant find out where anything goes even tho i am usin the part scanner i just cant find where things go

Lots of navigation issue. was disoriented often. They use locomotion teleport system which is the same as robo recall but some tweak would help. Also some object keep disappearing in the table so i had walktrough break 3 times and i'll stop for now but they hit a gold mine with this. ive been saying it for a long time. This is the kind of vr education we want and need. ill buy the full version. already learned so much. Guys keep going at it do focus group and play test to nail the navigation and fix them clipping bugs.Object manipulation need tweaks also.Experience like these need a top notch tutorial you can't skip a beat here. nail that and you'll have a hit

If you enjoy making things, building legos, taking things apart, and have even the slightest interest in learning how a combustion engine is built, you buy this game right now. I’ve never been so locked into a game before in life.

Want to learn how to construct an engine? Well here you go. Not got as far as putting the whole thing together yet but I will. I've promised myself for years that I would learn a little more about the combustion engine & with this I might :) Very interested to see where this is going.

They let you THROW WRENCHES!!!  The game itself is awesome but I'm not a mechanic so my engine didnt start and I hurled my wrench and man did that feel like the real deal.  I'll be buying this as soon as it hits the store.
My nephew loved this game and has already completed it twice. He keeps asking me to find something else like it for him to play.

Absolutely awesome.
The detail on the block and every component is top notch.
Looking forward to a full release.
One of the few games these days that I will happily pay full price for.
It's great game but not for everyone, I think it's mainly for who love or want try to build engine. Looking forward to full game!

Absolutely incredible initial gameplay, however for me there was no instruction on how to install the dipstick so i had no gauge to the amount of oil I was putting into the engine! other than that, flawless.
I know it’s the demo but it’s everything Car Mechanic wishes it was. The demo shows so much promise.
Hands down best "mechanic simulator" out there. Makes "Car Mechanic Simulator 2018" look like a childrens game. So excited for the early access release!
Fantastic App, as a trained Mechanic I wish I had something like this when I was learning! The detail is immense. Surely you can get some big names signed up to this as a development tool

review_title: Super excited for the full release!
one_reviews_text:
I'm not great at writing reviews but I thoroughly enjoyed playing through this!

My only gripe is that there was no way to get more oil as I had spilled some and wasn't able to put enough into the engine .-.

In my eyes this type of stuff excels all the time, added to wishlist from day1, awesome that i can ticker with a demo until full release, and cant wait...

love it !!!

Hours of tinkering without getting your hands dirty! This will be a day one buy.

A wee bit clunky in places but I'm sure the Dev's are hard at work on it.
This is a great application for Fun and Education. I was able to complete the task with the help of the tablet when needed and it was awesome. I can’t wait for more. I would live to see a full car.
I'd like to play this but it would be very hard to finish it.
Definetly the best "game" I've tried that utilized VR well.  Everything feels natural and works like you'd expect it to.  Can't wait to see what's next!
An other great example about what VR can do. This one has great graphics and its educational. Dont be mistaken, this is an AAA product that worths its money spent.
I only wish that I could have also built the cylinder head assembly as part of the tutorial. Even so, this game will be a day one buy for me.
The game is quite realistic, and I'd imagine it would be an amazing resource to learn how to be a car mechanic. Very excited for launch.
Can only rate it 2 stars right now as I am getting crashes after 5-10mins of gameplay. Haven't even gotten to start putting the engine together :(
review_feedback: Can you send me info about your hardware to missingdigitgames@gmail.com?

one_reviews_text: It's like playing lego. In VR. But better.
for the full version! I would suggest a click vibrate or noise for when you reach torque. Keep up the great work!

Looks good from the demo even nicer if the pistons was on the table
where are my pistons !
review_feedback: We patched a bug last night- You should have all of your parts back now.

one_reviews_text: i'll buy the full version in any case
I love that, so, i need translate french please xD
Waited for this for ages and seems good so far but could do with some tweaking

review_title: Best VR game I've ever seen
one_reviews_text: Best VR game I've ever seen, best game overall

one_reviews_text: Nothing else to say, 10/10
can't wait for the full release
Most realistic car mechanic game, i love it!!
